intro: Corchorus laniflorus, commonly known as the silky sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal uses, it is cultivated in some regions for both aesthetic and practical purposes.
